sources.title: Sergeant Rutledge (1960) Jeffrey Hunter, Woody Strode
sources.description: Arizona, 1881: Black Sergeant Rutledge ( Woody Strode ) is accused of double murder and rape. At the military court, he encounters blatant racism.   A lieutenant and a lady help him uncover the truth...  Ford tells this heroic story in visually brilliant flashbacks. For the first time in a Western, a Black John Wayne type rides a horse. Unfortunately, the Native Americans once again come away from it badly.

metadata.Plot: Lieutenant Tom Cantrell is sent to defend Sergeant Braxton Rutledge, a black cavalry soldier, on a charge of rape and murder. The story begins in a courtroom and it is told through flashbacks. This is a story of how a black soldier in the face of danger from the Indians can be so easily mistaken as a criminal.
metadata.Actors: Jeffrey Hunter, Woody Strode, Constance Towers
